channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large stone slab has been struck again and is laying precariously, on the edge, of the corner of the B4070 causing vehicles to avoid hitting the slab., 18th January
item.description:
Birdlip Hill at the junction with the B4070.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4070, Birdlip, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant water flowing freezing as black ice, 18th January
item.description:
Water flowing down the road and in to the entrance for the Community Centre is freezing over. In the morning this is sheet black ice, covering the whole width of the road (spread by vehicles going through the water). It also affects the only path to the Com Centre.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, North Road West, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Traffic light 2 facing wrong direction, 18th January
item.description:
Andoversford A40. From east filter lane to Bourton on the water, top of light twisted.Dangerous as signalling to other traffic.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Andoversford, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Traffic light head is facing wrong direction

item.title: Raised inspection cover, 18th January
item.description:
The raised inspection cover is on the pavement on the opposite side to the parade of shops (approx opposite Janeâ€™s Pantry). An accident has been reported when somebody had a bad fall because of the uneven surface caused by a raised inspection cove/manhole.

item.title: Traffic lights not taken away, 18th January
item.description:
It appears that the road works have finished as no work has been done for the past several days & all repairs have been filled in. However the traffic lights still remain causing chaos at rush hour. Has the traffic light management forgot to take them down??
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Road, Southam, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Information board identifying emergency contact company/number not displayed

item.title: Lots of rubbish again, 18th January
item.description:
Just a few weeks after this area was cleaned and the hedge cut, it's now looking a complete mess again. Not sure how this keeps happening in this Area

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Gristmill Close, Springbank, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned highways diversion sign, 18th January
item.description:
There's an diversion sign belonging to the Gloucestershire Highways depth, abandoned on the grass verge at the junction of Greenway Lane and Ashley Close (by no. 42 Greenway Lane), Charlton Kings. It's been there since work was carried out last year adding a drain to the road. Could you pick it up please? I reported this previously but the ticket was cancelled without the sign being picked up, so I've moved the sign to a more visible place.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ashley Close, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 18th January
item.description:
Report a problem-dangerous branch
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 5cm deep x 20cm in the worst area but larger than this. on Leckhampton Road see below., 18th January
item.description:
Triathlon.dressing.scoping on What3words. Large pothole and surrounding dipped area. The deepest part of the pot hole is the size of a dinner plate and about 5cm deep. It is on Leckhampton Road coming in to Cheltenham just after the right hand turn into the Star College Ullenwood and the Golf Club. I hit it yesterday and it split my tryre leaving a 3 inch gash. New tyre needed. Letter to follow to the council for compensation once we have the bill. We hope the wheel is not twisted.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckhampton Hill, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crossing sound extremely quiet and barely audible, 17th January
item.description:
Pedestrian crossing outside the Co-op on Salisbury Avenue, Cheltenham. The crossing sound is so quiet you can hardly hear it so it is dangerous. Problem present for a week.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 115, Salisbury Avenue, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
